{"step_by_step_thinking": "Managed care refers to a system of healthcare delivery that aims to control costs and improve quality by coordinating and managing the care of patients. It typically involves the use of a network of healthcare providers who agree to provide services to patients at pre-negotiated rates. Low income persons often face barriers to accessing healthcare, including lack of insurance coverage and limited financial resources. Managed care plans may offer more affordable options for low income individuals, such as Medicaid managed care programs. These programs often provide a usual source of care, such as a primary care physician, to enrollees. Therefore, it is likely that managed care enables more low income persons to identify a usual source of care.", "answer_choice": "A"}
